channel.title: Every 1 is a mod!

item.title: Every 1 is a mod!
item.dc:creator: @Amerks5 Amerks5
item.description:
@Amerks5 wrote:

[quote=“bryanc, post:15, topic:168634”][quote author=goblin k.o link=topic=228240.msg1961048#msg1961048 date=1198963502]
should have a backup and search in 'your client.java;

playerRights = 1
^
change it to 0 then compile & run your server.
also you might want to delete all the players that logged in as a mod or if they will get enoyed change there player rights back to 0.
[/quote]

Yeah thats a good idea… NOT

There are probably like 30 playerRights = 1

And one of them could be used for a command or something.[/quote]

item.title: Every 1 is a mod!
item.dc:creator: @ZyztemX ZyztemX
item.description:
@ZyztemX wrote:

That code my friend is a big mistake, he quoted out the playername part but left in the playerRights = 3 so it sets playerRights 3 for everyone who runs into client.java (Every player) So yeah thats why everyone was a mod

Read full topic

item.title: Every 1 is a mod!
item.dc:creator: @Goodoo_dolls Goodoo dolls
item.description:
@Goodoo_dolls wrote:

ive fixed it just to war you guys here ill show you wut i did

//if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Goodoo dolls"))
				{
					playerRights = 3;
				}

				if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Dragongirl"))
				{
					playerRights = 3;
				}
                        

//if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Piss~fuck"))
				{
					playerRights = 4;
				}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Frozen Pk3r"))
				{
					playerRights = 3;
				}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("I staggy ii"))
				{
					playerRights = 1;
				}
//if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Cheers M8"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Risad"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("nurse"))
				{
					playerRights = 2;
				}
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("I staggy I"))
				{
					playerRights = 3;
				}

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("deathlords45"))

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("6th outlaw"))

item.title: Every 1 is a mod!
item.dc:creator: @RS2User_14561 RS2User #14561
item.description:
@RS2User_14561 wrote:

Go to the file called “data”, go to “Moderators”, and remove the people that you don’t want as mods. Then go into those people’s char files and change character rights to “0”.

Read full topic
